conclusion: Object A is at a height of h = 1 m. Object B is at the bottom of the inclined plane. Both objects have a mass m = 1 kg. The inclined plane angle is θ = 37°. The system is released from rest.
Object A is suspended at a height of 1 meter above the ground. Object B is positioned at the bottom of the inclined plane.

premise: Object A is at a height of h = 1 m. Object B is at the bottom of the inclined plane. Both objects have a mass m = 1 kg.
conclusion: The only force acting on A is gravity, F_A = mg = 1 × 10 = 10 N.

premise: Object B is at the bottom of the inclined plane. The inclined plane angle is θ = 37°.
conclusion: The gravitational force component along the incline is F_{B,parallel} = mg sin θ = 10 sin 37°.
The net force on the system is F_{net} = F_A - F_{B,parallel} = 10 - 6 = 4 N.

premise: The total mass of the system is 2 kg.
conclusion: The acceleration a of the system is given by a = F_{net}/m_{total} = 4/2 = 2 m/s².
Using the equation of motion h = 1/2 a t², we solve for t: 1 = 1/2 × 2 × t² implies t² = 1 implies t = 1 s.
It takes 1 second for A to hit the ground.
Using v = at, Object B has a velocity of v = 2 × 1 = 2 m/s up the incline when A hits the ground.

premise: After the string breaks, B is only under the influence of gravity along the incline.
conclusion: The acceleration of B down the incline is a_B = g sin θ = 10 × 0.6 = 6 m/s².
Find the time t_1 for B to stop: v_f = v_i - a_B t_1 implies 0 = 2 - 6 t_1 implies t_1 = 2/6 = 1/3 s.
